item.title: RT UnstructuredIO: RAG with unstructured and semi-structured data presents unique challenges (and opportunities). In this blog we worked on a real-wor...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇUnstructuredIO
RAG with unstructured and semi-structured data presents unique challenges (and opportunities). In this blog we worked on a real-world healthcare use case with @LangChainAI to test emerging approaches related to Multi-Vector Retrieval. The challenge here was how to empower‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732130938748870934
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT WFH: üßêAGI is cool and all but have you tried generating JSON? Anyone building something useful with LLMs knows it has to integrate well both wit...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇWFH
üßêAGI is cool and all but have you tried generating JSON?

Anyone building something useful with LLMs knows it has to integrate well both with humans and other machines. Our extraction benchmark tests LLMs for both valid and correct outputs. Check it out!


LangChain:‚ÄÇ‚õèÔ∏èAnyone building with LLMs knows structured extraction is key.

Today we are releasing a new extraction benchmark testing LLM ability to infer structured data from chat logs. We've also shared some initial results below:

üîóhttps://blog.langchain.dev/extraction-benchmarking/
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re üí¨Grammar-based decoding (like logit biasing) helps, but isn't a panacea - model quality is also important for generating correct values, even af...
item.description: Re üí¨Grammar-based decoding (like logit biasing) helps, but isn't a panacea - model quality is also important for generating correct values, even after you have the structure locked down.
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re ü¶úWe also explored different prompting strategies using a 32B Llama model to see how they impact output performance. For this task (and model), s...
item.description:
Re ü¶úWe also explored different prompting strategies using a 32B Llama model to see how they impact output performance.

For this task (and model), simple, static strategies didn‚Äôt work that well in isolationüò¨!
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re ‚öñÔ∏èUnsurprisingly, GPT-4 with tool-calling ability performed the best on this benchmark, but Llama, even when not fine-tuned, performed well . See...
item.description:
Re ‚öñÔ∏èUnsurprisingly, GPT-4 with tool-calling ability performed the best on this benchmark, but Llama, even when not fine-tuned, performed well . See the comparison at this link:

https://smith.langchain.com/public/00f4444c-9460-4a82-b87a-f50096f1cfef/d/compare?selectedSessions=0c022691-a7ac-4545-b2bc-58aab2d476e8%2Cd522dbfc-c09b-45a9-b11e-26aa95a3555a
item.author: LangChain

item.title: Re üß™We tested popular models like GPT-4, Claude, Llama, and Yi using different prompting and decoding techniques to see how much they impact perfor...
item.description:
Re üß™We tested popular models like GPT-4, Claude, Llama, and Yi using different prompting and decoding techniques to see how much they impact performance for things like:

- Question classification
- Sentiment analysis
- Nested JSON schema correctness
item.author: LangChain

item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üì¨ Gmail Tools for Agents üì¨

Your @LangChainAI ü¶úüîó JS/TS 0.0.201 agents can now retrieve + send emails via Gmail!

You can also create drafts for manual review if you‚Äôre not ready to go fully autonomous.

Thanks 1239uth, and @UofT for encouraging OSS!

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/tools/gmail
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Prince Canuma: üöÄ Big news from @Kulissiwa! Our new RAG pipeline now hits 99% accuracy with <5 sec latency. Thanks to user feedback and access to...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇPrince Canuma
üöÄ Big news from @Kulissiwa!

Our new RAG pipeline now hits 99% accuracy with <5 sec latency.

Thanks to user feedback and access to @LangChainAI Langsmith, we've revamped our approach with Edge functions, smart filtering, and context-aware queries.

Check out Kulissiwa:‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732022224494760078
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Jo Kristian Bergum: Playing with @LangChainAI and Vespa streaming mode with multi-vector representations. LangChain has evolved for the better over...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJo Kristian Bergum
Playing with @LangChainAI and Vespa streaming mode with multi-vector representations.

LangChain has evolved for the better over the last few months, with fewer "magic" hidden prompts, and the LangChain Expression Language (LCEL) reminds me of Vespa indexing language.
item.author: LangChain

item.title: ‚≠êÔ∏èBuilding RAG Pipelines that Use Multiple LLMs: Query Transformation ‚≠êÔ∏è Many advanced RAG pipelines make multiple calls to LLMs at various stages...
item.description:
‚≠êÔ∏èBuilding RAG Pipelines that Use Multiple LLMs: Query Transformation ‚≠êÔ∏è

Many advanced RAG pipelines make multiple calls to LLMs at various stages. Most existing templates currently use the same LLM for all stages, but there's no reason that has to be the case.

Over the coming‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1731724086072779109
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: üìê Gradient LLMs + Embeddings üìê You can swap in @Gradient_AI_ private, custom-trained LLMs and embeddings into your @LangChainAI ÔøΩ...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
üìê Gradient LLMs + Embeddings üìê

You can swap in @Gradient_AI_ private, custom-trained LLMs and embeddings into your @LangChainAI ü¶úüîó JS/TS projects!

This also includes support for model adapters.

Thank you to @ChaseMcDou!

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/llms/gradient_ai

üåå üõù Multimodal support in LangSmith Playground

With the announcement of GPT-4-vision models, it has never been easier to convert rough sketches into runnable prototypes.

Nevertheless, a simple prompt may not suffice, and prompt engineering can guide the LLM to yield better‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1731707919530406121

- You can trace and see all chat conversations on your copilots
